transcription: Revealed, Children as young as 4 are posting explicit images of themselves online and engaging with sexual predators. A new cyber safety program will target children as young as 4 in response to the overwhelming use of smartphones.  Data shows the AFP received more than 10,000 reports of child exploitation material in the last year, leading the to arrest of 91 alleged offenders for 208 child sex offenses. On Tuesday law enforcement Minister Angus Taylor said the training initiative was aimed at the extraordinary scope of risk.  engaging with online child sex offenders, Mr Taylor told the Daily Telegraph. He said as a parent the reports were deeply concerning, and highlighted kids as young as five are potential victims.  target children through apps and online games. The program will collaborate information from the joint anti-child exploitation teams and from the eSafety Commissioner.
